content: lattice dishcloth i love the way the post crochet stitches form a lattice climbing up between the shells and those lattices are great for scrubbing dishes materials 100% cotton worsted weight yarn 1 ball crochet hook size n i crochet tightly so you may want to use a hook two or three sizes smaller abbreviations chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch st = stitch single_crochet = single_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet round = round beg = beginning space = space fp = front post stitch from front of work make double_crochet around post of double_crochet in previous round bp = back post stitch from back of work make double_crochet around post of double_crochet in previous round instructions chain 27 row 1 double_crochet in fourth chain from hook skip next chain * 3 double_crochet-shell in next chain skip next chain double_crochet in next chain repeat from * across end with chain 3 turn throughout pattern chain-3 counts as first st of next row row 2 skip first double_crochet 3-double_crochet shell in next st center double_crochet of last row s shell skip next double_crochet bp work in this manner across row having a shell in the center st of each shell and a bp stitch around each double_crochet between shells chain 3 turn row 3 skip first double_crochet 3-double_crochet shell in next st center double_crochet of last row s shell skip next double_crochet fp work in this manner across row having a shell in the center st of each shell and a fp stitch around each double_crochet between shells chain 3 turn repeat row 2 and 3 until dishcloth is desired height edging round 1 single_crochet evenly around dishcloth working 3 single_crochet in each corner round 2 chain 1 single_crochet in same st single_crochet in each single_crochet around working 3 single_crochet in center single_crochet of 3-single_crochet corners join with slip_stitch to beg single_crochet and fasten yarn weave in ends © 2006 beverly button http //www buttonspecialties com
